intro: Volutaria saharae, commonly known as the Saharan volutaria, is a rare and specialized plant native to the arid regions of the Sahara Desert. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. This plant is adapted to extreme desert conditions, with deep root systems that allow it to access groundwater. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits. Due to its limited distribution and fragile habitat, it is considered a vulnerable species.
